Xi and Putin's strategic friendship
subhead: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Beijing on Tuesday, on the eve of a major military parade, for what was at least his 45th meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping since both leaders have held power. Their close ties reflect the alliance Russia and China have forged against the West.
byline: By Benjamin Quénelle and Harold Thibault (Tianjin (China) special correspondent)

title: French far right says no breakthrough in talks with PM Bayrou ahead of confidence vote
Gérard Depardieu ordered to stand trial for rape
Scant resources delay rescue efforts after Afghanistan earthquake
subhead: The earthquake that struck near Jalalabad, in eastern Afghanistan, overnight from Sunday to Monday has left more than 1,400 people dead and 3,000 injured. The difficulty in accessing some remote valleys and the shortcomings of the Taliban regime have raised fears of an even higher death toll.

title: Italy retorts after 'fiscal dumping' remarks by French MP Bayrou revive tensions
subhead: The French prime minister's comments regarding Italian tax policy for the ultra-wealthy sparked outrage in Italy on Sunday, including from Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, who emphasized the stability of her government.

title: Venice Film Festival: Julia Roberts shines in Luca Guadagnino's 'After the Hunt'
subhead: The American actress plays a woman torn between ambition and principle in this film, presented out of competition, which examines morality and ethics in the wake of #MeToo.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'To succeed in the climate transition, we must redistribute wealth differently'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the French economist explains that protecting the planet from climate change cannot be achieved without reducing inequality.
byline: Interview by Nabil Wakim and Cécile Cazenave

'By challenging the Fed's independence, Donald Trump is taking a dangerous gamble'
subhead: Repeated attacks on the central bank, meant to force it to lower interest rates, in defiance of economic data, threaten financial stability. Disregarding reality for political convenience can have dramatic consequences, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: Block Everything is 'a movement structured almost exclusively around radical left sympathizers'
subhead: Bristielle conducted a study in the online groups of the Block Everything movement on September 10. He found that only 27% of respondents claimed to have been part of the Yellow Vest movement in 2019, he explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Marcel Gauchet, historian and philosopher: 'Progressivism has locked itself into a denial of uncomfortable realities'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era' (2/6). The democracy specialist explains that we are witnessing a major ideological reversal after decades of depoliticization that have allowed neoliberal individualism and 'libertarian societal values' to triumph.
